Judge Blocks ICE From Randomly Stopping Suspected Migrants in Immigration Raids
Source: Bloomberg    Published: 2025-07-12 03:59:00

Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Trump's Immigration Policy: A federal judge in Los Angeles issued an order temporarily blocking US authorities from using racial or ethnic profiling during immigration sweeps in the region and requiring that detainees get access to lawyers. The order Friday by US District Judge Maame Ewusi-Mensah Frimpong is the latest fallout from the Trump administration's controversial crackdown on migrants in California and across the US. It came in a lawsuit by a group of Southern California residents, workers and advocacy groups who accused President Donald Trump's administration of terrorizing the population with heavy handed and unconstitutional tactics.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


Prime Day Ends in One Hour ‚Äî These Are the Deals Worth Buying Before Then
Source: Business Insider    Published: 2025-07-12 02:26:15

This is it ‚Äî we've made it to the final hour of Amazon's longest Prime Day yet. But before calling it quits for the night, make sure you've double-checked your shopping list and purchased everything you needed. After all, the deals all end tonight. Tons of discounts have come and gone in the last four days, and once the clock strikes midnight Pacific, almost all of them will expire. We've compared prices across thousands of deals this week, and below, you'll find highlights of some of our favorite picks from our collection of reviews and buying guides. This way, you know you're only getting deal recommendations for items we think are worth your cash, especially with today's tasty discounts. When you have small and sensitive ears like mine, you have to be really picky about your headphones. I strongly dislike in-ear earbuds that extend too far into my ear canal, so I was elated when Apple announced its newest AirPods, which would maintain a similar form factor as its predecessors but offer active noise cancellation. These things are great, and although their ANC isn't quite as strong as the Pro 2's, they are good enough for regular use while out and about. For Prime Day's remaining hours, the wireless charging versions are down to $119, and the USB-C charging ones are down to $89, both excellent all-time lows. If you have yet to pick up a pair during the sale, I recommend acting fast. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor I've never seen the AirPods Pro 2 at a better price than this. Past sales have seen them dip to $160, but you're generally looking at $180-$200 for a standard discount during more low-key sales. The audio quality and noise-cancelling both received massive upgrades over the first-gen Pros. If you have the original Pro 2s with the Lightning cable, the only difference besides the charging port is added dust resistance, so I'd hold off for the next-gen Pros rather than pick these up. Ditching that old Lightning cable for good is definitely tempting, though. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director Apple's latest MacBook Air received a major boost for productivity fans this year as it now allows you to connect to two external displays while also using the laptop screen. The M4 chip is a powerful beast, and its base model with 16GB of RAM will handle a fair bit of multitasking and light media editing if you're looking to save money over a MacBook Pro. This super-light and portable laptop is a great buy if you're heading to college. It will be supported by updates for years to come. Better yet, this is the cheapest price yet, and it likely won't get any lower before you head back to campus. Is it even Prime Day if you don't buy another Echo speaker? While Alexa hasn't really evolved in years, we still find quite a lot of use for these smart speakers. OK, most of it is setting timers and asking it the time or for weather forecasts, but Amazon is promising AI upgrades sooner rather than later. Hopefully, they're a bit more on it than Apple's utterly botched Siri Apple Intelligence rollout. So why the Echo Pop? It's the cheapest of all the Echo speakers right now and a great entry-level model for anyone new to smart speakers. It's a nice size for a nightstand or a little music speaker on your desk. It's not particularly powerful, but a decent work-at-home option that won't disturb the rest of the house and can give your ears a break from wearing headphones all day. You could also pair it with a smart plug like the one highlighted below. The entire Echo line is on sale for Prime Day until Friday, including the ones with a display at Amazon. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director This is a neat (and cheap!) device that can help turn some regular household items into smart devices that can be activated by remote control via Alexa on your phone or Echo smart speaker (it won't work with Google or Apple speakers). Typical uses include activating lamps or electric fans. Coffee makers are also potential winners, as they can keep the coffee pot heated or even be turned off remotely to save on energy bills. If your device needs button presses to activate, though, just remember that this won't help unless you can leave it in 'on mode'‚Äîlike a physical light switch on a lamp. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director We specifically recommend the Amazon Omni QLED 50-inch for its balance of cost and performance in our guide to the best 50-inch TVs, even though we think the larger sizes of this model are overpriced. It comes bundled with convenient Alexa features and is one of the few of its size to offer local dimming, giving good contrast performance. For Prime Day, it's 33% off, but that ends in an hour, so you'll want to act fast to save on this affordable option. It's on sale frequently, but almost never for this low. My Garmin GPS watch, a Forerunner 55, is 15% off on Amazon right now, but the best Garmin deal on Prime Day is on the v√≠voactive 5. The brand is a popular option among those looking to track their workouts, fitness routines, and general health-related stats, but my greatest reason for recommending it is the battery life. I've gone well over a week on a single charge, and I'm wearing my watch on every run and while I sleep at night. The v√≠voactive 5 boasts 11 days of battery life, and at 37% off, it's just $1 shy of the cheapest price we've ever seen it listed at, so you'll be hard-pressed to find a better deal than this. ‚Äî Lillian Brown, Streaming Associate Editor Trying to decide between these two Prime Day Kindle deals? That's quite a price difference between the two, but both are excellent e-reader. I have both, and I swap between them regularly, so there's no bad option here. I use the Paperwhite the most because the larger screen means fewer page turns. I also like the flush screen design, which prevents dust or hair from tucking into the bezel, which is a tiny issue with the cheaper model. The Paperwhite has a few premium touches that make it worth the price, especially when it's on sale like this. It's waterproof, making it much safer to read poolside, in the bath, or to protect against spills in your bag. The adjustable warm-light feature makes the screen easier on the eyes and can be tweaked to a soft golden glow, which is very pleasing on the eye as it looks like an old paperback. As for the cheaper model, it's smaller, but that actually works in its favor as I've found it fits into inside jacket pockets easily (the Paperwhite is too big for some pockets) and I've even squeezed it into some jean pockets. It's much easier to read one-handed for all you commuters who can't get a seat on the train or bus. If you're new to e-readers and are just getting back into reading, the cheaper model is a safe bet. Kindles drop to these awesome prices every Prime Day and Black Friday season, so you're never far away from a great deal if you decide to upgrade down the line. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director Digital notepads are really taking off, and this is the Kindle brand's second take on the large format, and it's never been cheaper. In addition to being a Kindle e-reader with a massive 10.2" display - excellent for those who prefer to read in a large print font - it's an excellent size for taking notes with the included pen. I use one every day at work, and the various templates and folder setups are a massive improvement over the scraps of paper that used to litter my desk or get lost at the bottom of my workbag. This version comes with the Premium Pen (which costs extra on the last-gen model), an eraser button on the top, and a programmable shortcut key. If you have the original Scribe, I'd skip this one, as the design has not changed significantly, and both have the same software upgrades. Which more recently have included AI options that transcribe your notes into digital text, with mixed results, I must say. That said, I can barely read my own handwriting, so I can cut it some slack here. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director Philips Hue is the most recognizable brand in the smart lighting game, and the vast range of colors available via the app on these super-long-lasting bulbs makes them my top pick whenever anyone asks me about them. They're brutally expensive, though, so waiting for a Prime Day deal is certainly the way to go. This is a major discount, too, and one that might not come back around until Black Friday. These are certainly items I'd say are vulnerable to price hikes if the tariffs hit. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director Despite being a few generations old now, Sony has continued to manufacture their XM4 noise-canceling headphones, and we're not complaining one bit. They remain a phenomenal value and are much preferred by many music fans over the XM5 thanks to their much more compact design for storage, comfy fit, and a price that's so much cheaper than modern greats from Sony, Bose, and Apple. You simply can't get a better set of headphones than this for under $200. My dad somehow lost his headphones on the way to Greece‚Äîtragic, right? Call this perfect timing, but it was the easiest replacement ever to rebuy them for him during Prime Day. And they were cheaper than when I got them for him last Father's Day. Now, they'll arrive home before his flight touches down in America. ‚Äî Jaclyn Turner, Senior Home Editor Beats are a recurring participant at every Amazon deals event, but a price this good is rare. At over 50% off, this Prime Day discount matches some of the best deals we've seen for the Beats Solo 4 in the past. I love this little fan from Jisulife ‚Äî it's worth every penny of the $20 sticker price, but for Prime Day, it's on sale for as low as $13, and it's my responsibility to highly recommend you buy it. ‚Äî Lauren Savoie, Deputy Executive Editor Even though this editor-favorite folding mini fan isn't very expensive and sees discounts somewhat regularly, at $13, it's a much better deal than we usually see in the summer. Oura is the biggest name in smart rings and is our go-to pick, even over Samsung's Galaxy Ring. If you're looking for a subtle health tracker that looks pretty cool as well, you can't go wrong here. Multiple sizes and colors are on sale today. The Oura can track various fitness and wellness metrics, including sleep, heart rate, steps, and other activities. Many find wearing a smartwatch all the time, especially when sleeping, is a bit much. So a smart ring is a great alternative if you don't mind having to use your phone to check out the data. The eight-day battery batters Apple and Samsung's smartwatch efforts, too. Though we've seen it drop lower in the past, it's been a while since the 2nd Gen Apple Pencil has been discounted this much. At only $89, this is a steal for an accessory that so flawlessly integrates with compatible iPads for writing, drawing, and more. I've been drawing as a hobby since I was young, but digital art was always one of my weak points ‚Äî until I picked up an Apple Pencil. I've since upgraded my setup to the same 2nd Gen Apple Pencil featured in this deal and an iPad Air because it just makes sketching digitally so much easier and portable. Even when not drawing, the accessory makes note-taking and photo editing so much easier and precise. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor These sporty earbuds use the same H1 Apple chip that second- and third-gen AirPods use, earning it the top spot in our guide to the best AirPods alternatives. They integrate similarly with Apple devices but also include an Android app, making them versatile enough for users outside of the Apple ecosystem. Though they're on sale often, this drop to $149 is an especially great deal price for the Beats Fit Pro. They're more expensive than the latest generation of AirPods, but this discount makes buying a pair a little easier. When it comes to cheap wireless earbuds, it doesn't get better than a $20 pair of Amazon Echo Buds. After testing these budget smart headphones for our review, I found them to be a decent investment for Alexa users or a nice, affordable option with a comfortable form factor. At full price, I wouldn't recommend them for everyone, but at 60% off during Prime Day, they make an excellent gift or spare set to keep in your work bag. They're lightweight and provide on-the-go Alexa support. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Editor, deals and how to watch At $80 off, the Apple Watch SE 2nd Gen is the lowest price we usually see the smartwatch reach, so now is a good time to buy if you've been thinking of making a purchase. The SE 2nd Gen is a solid entry point for the Apple Watch, thanks to its (relatively) low price point and robust set of features. It's a great option for fitness, sleep, and heart rate tracking within the Apple ecosystem. ‚Äî Lillian Brown, Streaming Associate Editor The Samsung S90D hits just the right sweet spot between price and performance. It also boasts a healthy assortment of smart features and a handsome design. ‚Äî Steven Cohen, Senior Tech Editor At 29% off for the 77-inch and 31% off for the 65-inch, these are some solid deals that match the lows we've seen earlier this year. They've been dipping in and out of stock over the duration of the event, and after Prime Day, they'll be gone for sure. Our budget 75-inch TV pick, the Roku Plus Series, is an entry-level QLED with quantum dots and local dimming for solid contrast and color performance despite its low price. The Roku interface is also intuitive and easy to navigate, especially if you've used the popular brand before. At 35% off, this is a steal, albeit not the lowest we've ever seen this TV drop before. Hindsight is 20/20, and sometimes, it's not until I'm out of the house that I realize I didn't charge my phone all night. It's times like these that my compact Anker 633 Magnetic Battery saves the day. This MagSafe backup battery conveniently snaps onto the back of my iPhone and juices it up without the use of an annoying cable. I see this specific model drop in price a lot throughout the year, but this is an especially good deal price that I wouldn't miss this Prime Day. It's a game-changing accessory that hardly makes a dent in my purse space, and at $25 off with a clipped on-page coupon, it's a steal. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor I've loved PopSockets since they first released years ago, but once MagSafe charging became an integral feature to modern iPhones, I had to ditch my beloved adhesive phone grip because it interfered with the magnetic capabilities. Thankfully, PopSockets released a MagSafe option that powerfully claps onto the back of my phone but easily comes off so I can charge or even just change cases as needed. Now, for Prime Day, the MagSafe PopSocket is $8 off in a handful of different colors. I can't recommend jumping on this deal enough; these grips don't usually dip this low. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor I've been trying out the Bissell FurFinder for the last few weeks, and I'm pretty impressed with how it cleans. I love that it can stand upright by itself, has a built-in crevice tool in the handheld portion, and has some pretty strong LED lights. It's not perfect, though. It's a little top-heavy, and I've noticed that long strands of my hair do wrap around the brush roll. However, for $129, this is one very effective cordless vacuum from a reputable brand. ‚Äî Jaclyn Turner, Senior Home Editor Most of the year, it's hard to find the FurFinder for any less than its full-priced $230. For Prime Day, it's $100 off, which likely won't last long after the day ends. I bought this budget cordless vacuum cleaner myself a few months back after spending a lot of time researching the cheapest options available on Amazon. Yes, there were cheaper options, but many were lacking in the power department, and the Tikom V500 seemed to pack a bigger punch than anything else while still coming in under $100. I've been very happy with it so far. The battery lasts 34 minutes in normal mode and 19 on turbo. Normal is great for grabbing tiny bits of debris or cat litter and tufts of tumbleweed-like cat hair, while I use turbo for full apartment cleans or grabbing heavier things like dry cat food kibble. It's a little heavy in handheld mode, but I feel I've got a real bargain compared to the amount of money you'd spend on a brand like Dyson. That said, if you do fancy a splurge, the Dsyon V8 Plus is 36% off at $299. If you're in a small carpet-free apartment, though, I think you're better off with the Tikom. Check out our guide to the best cordless vacuum cleaners for more details about other options. The even-smaller version of Bissell's popular Little Green portable vacuum cleaner offers the same great performance, designed for even tighter spaces. The larger size is the compact pick in our guide to the best portable vacuum cleaner. It's almost never on sale, and though it's a household tool worth its full price, it's even more worth it at 26% off. Chances are, after Prime Day, deals for it will once again be few and far between, so don't hesitate to pick one up if you're on the fence. I bought one of these last year on Prime Day, and it's still working fantastically despite being used multiple times a day. I use it for cat hair and fluff around the house on the bed, sofa, and even on my clothes - like when your pet does a drive by, walking past and covering your trousers in hair just as you're almost out the door. It's infinitely better than those useless lint rollers, and emptying it is super easy. The storage barrel holds a lot of hair, so I don't need to empty it that often. It's a little noisy to use as the plastic casing clanks around while brushing. It annoys the cat no end when I'm brushing around her, but until she starts cleaning up after herself, she's just going to have to take it. It's a tad difficult to use on looser surfaces like a thin blanket, as it's the backward and forward motions that pull up the hair, so only brushing one way doesn't work as well. So you'll need to pull blankets taught on both sides to get the roller working. Seriously, though, it's worth it just for the sofas alone. ‚Äî Brendan Griffiths, Senior Commerce Director Some of the best standing desks are getting pretty pricey, even when they don't offer extra features. Flexispot has done a great job of keeping costs down, though, on their entry-level models, and this Prime Day discount is a great chance to check out the growing trend at home. Prices go even lower if you choose one of the smaller surfaces, and there are many colors to choose from as well. You can program different pre-set heights for sitting and standing for more than one user. This one also has a hook for headphones, which is a super basic extra touch, but one we love to see. Govee's outdoor lights have been a huge hit. They are an excellent addition to your home if you're spending time outside during these summer nights, and they can also double as Christmas lights. As they're smart bulbs, you can choose a range of modes and colors via the app for any occasion. They can even be set to vibe with your music. And at 144ft, you're not limited to a small coverage area. The Hatch Restore 3 is one of those items that very rarely go on sale. If you've been thinking about it, this $30 discount is the best you can find, and it even extends to the new pink hue, Rosy. On first glance, I thought the Hatch Restore was an overhyped wake up light, but it's features extend far beyond pretty light displays and a nice wake up tune‚Ä¶ it also incorporates a wind-down routine (think exclusive podcasts, meditations, sounds) and can be used throughout the night as a sound machine too. The one thing the Hatch Restore stops short of is sleep tracking. However, to get the most out of all the features and settings, you'll have to subscribe to Hatch+, which costs $50 annually, but your purchase gives you 30 days free to try it out. ‚Äî Jaclyn Turner, Senior Home Editor I do a lot of baking at home, and there are few kitchen tools I come back to more than my KitchenAid mixer. The compact Classic version has a paddle, whisk, and dough hook attachment, helping you evenly combine ingredients for any recipe. Plus, you can add more attachments, like a pasta maker, if you want. Despite its smaller size, this KitchenAid still packs plenty of power with 10 mixing speeds. The individual parts are also dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. I came across these on protein brownies on TikTok at some point, but was nervous to spend $40 on the whole pack. Since then, I've seen these sold individually at Five Below and literally today at Lidl, but this deal brings the Birthday Cake Blondie flavor down to just $20 for a pack of 12, which doesn't feel as risky. I've never seen it priced anywhere near this low. These protein brownies are perfectly moist, flavorful, and a helpful way to get more protein in while also indulging in a sweet, yet not completely, guilty treat. ‚Äî Jaclyn Turner, Senior Home Editor As a certified coffee snob who lives in a tiny New York apartment, the Nespresso Vertuo Pop+ has been an absolute lifesaver. With the help of the Aeroccino3 Milk Frother, which is also 25% off for Prime Day, I can use it to make all the coffee and espresso drinks I love, hot or iced. But its compact footprint means it doesn't take up too much valuable kitchen real estate. This limited edition version of our favorite budget Nespresso machine is cute-as-can-be with pistachio accents, making it the perfect pop of color to add to your kitchen. ‚Äî Jennifer Gonick, Coupon and Deals Fellow No one wants to find themselves in a desperate situation for survival, but if you're an avid hiker, camper, or outdoorsman, something like the LifeStraw is an essential emergency kit tool. In our LifeStraw review, we praise its ease of use and portability for single users. While it can't filter large quantities of water for a group, it's a must-have for solo adventurers. It sees sales somewhat regularly throughout the year, but right now, it's down to its all-time lowest price of $10. Even if you're not the most dedicated camper, it's hard to argue with a steep discount for a tool that turns many liquids into drinkable water. If you're a hot sleeper, look no further than our top memory foam cooling pillow. Dual gel layers and a quilted cooling cover mean you never have to turn this pillow over to the cool side. The pillow's medium firmness offers the perfect amount of pressure relief around the neck and shoulders for back and side sleepers, helping you maintain spine alignment throughout the night. At 57% off, it's rare to see a price this good. I'm not the only person to wax poetic about this adjustable pillow from Coop Sleep Goods ‚Äî several of us on the Reviews team have invested in our top pillow pick and fallen in love. Its adjustability makes it versatile for different sleeper preferences, and after using mine for almost a year, it hasn't flattened at all. Though it's pretty common to find it on sale during most deal events, it's not until something like Prime Day that it drops to its lowest price. Seriously, if you're at all on the fence, let me join the chorus of recommendations for this pillow. I'm buying one for my husband during this 20% off sale, so he stops stealing mine. - Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor One of our top mattresses for back pain, the Nectar Classic Mattress is made with premium gel memory foam that molds to your specific body shape to expertly relieve pressure. Its medium firmness will be a particularly good choice for side sleepers, but it can be well-suited for any sleep type. Having covered the best queen mattress sales by retailer every week for months, I can tell you it's rare to see the queen Nectar Classic Mattress drop below $649, but for Prime Day, you can get it for just $537, making it one of our top Prime Day mattress deals. If you get bitten up by mosquitoes during the summer, no matter which bug spray you wear, consider investing in this rechargeable repeller. Unlike other mosquito repellants you spray on yourself, this one has no chemical scent. All you have to do is set it up in an area that gets a lot of mosquito activity (like your backyard), and it'll create a "protection zone" of up to 20 feet. At its lowest price ever for Prime Day, you won't want to miss this deal. Back when I still lived with my mom, I invested in the Coway Airmega AP-1512HH in an attempt to stave off her overwhelming allergies to my new rescue dog. It was a last-ditch effort, and to everyone's surprise, it worked! It's been six years since, but the Airmega continues working silently and powerfully in the corner of my living room, making the air notably less dandery for me and my guests. I think this thing is worth full price, so a 33% discount makes the deal even sweeter. It's on sale often, but not usually for this low; this Prime Day deal is a must-buy for anyone interested in our top air purifier pick. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor There are few cookware pieces as versatile as a Dutch oven, and I should know. My Le Creuset Dutch Oven is one of my kitchen essentials. It's amazing how many recipes it can be used for, from soups to sauces to loaves of bread. In addition to being a great kitchen companion, this Dutch oven is also beautiful to look at and will last you decades. It's not cheap, though, so I'd grab it at over $100 off before it's too late. If you want to elevate your cup of coffee in the morning, one meaningful upgrade is not switching up your roast but making sure your coffee is ground fresh. Fresh-ground coffee unlocks fresh aromas and flavors that you just can't get from pre-ground coffee. The OXO Brew Conical Burr Grinder is a great entry-level option, with 15 settings to tinker with, whether you're brewing for French Press or Espresso. OXO knows good design; the products speak for themselves, and they don't often go on sale. This is the lowest price since February, and before that, a brief time in December, the grinder dipped just a few dollars below $70. Likewise, if you want to upgrade your coffee maker while you're at it, the OXO 8-cup coffee maker is also 29% off. It's no frills but lets the coffee focus take center stage. ‚Äî Jaclyn Turner, Senior Home Editor A college dorm lifesaver, this cute and compact Keurig fits into the smallest corners of any space. It can brew six to 12 ounces at a time and has a convenient top-fill design that allows you to pour water straight into the machine. For Prime Day, all five hues of the machine are 50% off, so you can get the one that best matches your aesthetic. Espresso making is hardly a cheap hobby to dive into, but with the Casabrews Espresso Machine, it can cost a little less. It's the top pick in our guide to the best budget espresso machine, with a sleek steel design that impresses visually and in terms of durability. It's back down to $119, matching its previous all-time low that it occasionally dips to. This deal ends in an hour, along with Prime Day, but there is a chance it can crop up again in a few months. I used to be a nonbeliever in the Scrub Daddy hype, but after trying these little guys out on my own dishes, I believe the hype. These texture-changing sponges are perfect for getting tough, caked-on grime, and they're more durable than other sponges I've used. I'd also like to believe that their smiley demeanor makes doing dishes a little less painful. Scrub Daddy's have seen sales before, but this 20% discount is especially worthwhile. Whether you're already a fan or looking to be convinced, this Prime Day deal is the one to jump on. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor One of the best Prime Day hacks is checking to see if an item you'll need to buy anyway is on sale, and then purchasing in bulk. Tide PODS are essential for me, and I especially like the Free & Gentle version (now 20% off) since it doesn't smell like much but still gets the job done. It's hypoallergenic, too, which means it's a good option for those with sensitive and reactive skin. Sproos makes our favorite filtered shower head. I've been using mine for a year now, and I never thought it was possible to love a shower head, but I really do. First of all, it totally upgraded my crappy apartment shower and made it somewhere I actually want to be in the morning. It's simple and attractive, and it was so easy for me to install by myself in just a few minutes. It's an instant upgrade. Many people swear by filtered shower heads, saying they work wonders for hair and skin. I personally haven't noticed a big difference, other than that my hair dye seems to last a few weeks longer (the shower head filters out chlorine in the water). If you want to save a good chunk of money, the unfiltered version is on sale for $55, less than half the price of the filtered version. The no-frills Original Wet Brush is genuinely one of the hero products of my lifetime. As someone with long, thick hair that's prone to knotting, combing through my wet hair after a shower used to be a nightmare. I picked this up on a whim at least a decade ago, and I've never been without one ever since. I was skeptical at first that the Wet Brush's soft, flexible bristles would actually detangle my hair, but the brush glides through hair like a dream, painlessly loosening any knots along the way with minimal breakage. At just $6, it's a steal. The first time I used this product, my hair was in dire condition: dry, dull, and frizzy from repeated bleaching and heat styling. After just one application, I could already see a dramatic difference, and it cemented itself as one of the best hair oils I'd tried. Not only did my strands appear shinier and feel softer, but there was noticeably less frizz and flyaways. ‚Äî Rebecca Strong, Reviews Contributor The top pick in our guide to the best hair oils, the Unite U Oil, is a solid investment for users with a variety of textures. It'll usually run you over $50, but, ending soon for Prime Day, it's discounted by 20% for the first time in a while. I've been using this sunscreen on my runs for years. While I'm happy to use a simple spray-on sunscreen on the rest of my body, I prefer something gentler on my face and chest. It's heavy-duty SPF 70+, without a heavy-duty feel, so I feel protected when I'm outside but not bogged down by an oily paste. All you have to do is stick one on clean, dry skin and forget about it for six to eight hours while it absorbs gunk and flattens the zit. Not all of the colors are the same price, but if your shade is on sale, I'd recommend jumping on it. ‚Äî Sarah Saril, Deals and How to Watch Editor Prime Day officially ends at 11:59 p.m. PT on Friday, July 11. However, some offers are one-day 'daily deals', while others will only last as long as the stock does. Lightning Deals, especially the really good ones, are usually only live for a few hours. No, but most are. Some items are just on a general discount, and we've spotted quite a few like that this year. The majority are locked behind Prime membership. On the plus side, if you're not a member or haven't been for quite some time, you'll be able to get a 30-day free trial, and you're free to cancel as soon as Prime is over. Very difficult to say. Many prices are the best we've seen so far this year, but there's a chance that the Black Friday deals in November could go lower, especially as more stores get involved. For Amazon's own devices, though, there's a strong chance that these are the best prices, or they won't go any lower for Black Friday. Tariffs could be a big factor this year, and prices on goods made (or containing non-US parts) outside the US could rise. This could really hit electronics in particular, so if you've been thinking of getting a new TV or laptop, we'd get one sooner rather than later. The initial July 9th deadline for tariff agreements has been extended for some countries, but it won't affect Prime Day prices mid-sale anyway, as those items will already have been shipped to the US beforehand. 'Dune' Studio Legendary Weighs Acquisition of Lionsgate Studios (LION)
Source: Bloomberg    Published: 2025-07-12 00:44:00

Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Lionsgate Studios in Yonkers, New York. Legendary Entertainment LLC, the independent film and TV studio behind the Dune trilogy and A Minecraft Movie, is considering a takeover of Lionsgate Studios Corp., according to people familiar with the matter. Legendary, which is backed by Apollo Global Management, first approached the company after Lionsgate finalized its separation from the Starz Entertainment Corp. TV network and streaming service in May, said the people, who asked not be named as the information is private. Those talks centered on a potential partnership to produce a handful of films so that Legendary could gauge how the companies worked together and whether it should ultimately proceed with a takeover offer, the people said.

Jane Street India Ban Threatens 900% Rally for Asia's Oldest Stock Exchange
Source: Bloomberg    Published: 2025-07-12 00:00:00

Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Connecting decision makers to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas, Bloomberg quickly and accurately delivers business and financial information, news and insight around the world Americas+1 212 318 2000 EMEA+44 20 7330 7500 Asia Pacific+65 6212 1000 Asia's oldest stock exchange was preparing to celebrate its 150th anniversary when a storm of bad news upended the festivities. On Monday, a report revealed deepening losses in equity derivatives among India's retail traders, fueling concerns that the Securities and Exchange Board of India may impose tighter curbs. Just days earlier, the regulator barred Jane Street Group from dealing in local markets, alleging the trading giant manipulated prices to make billions of dollars at the expense of small investors ‚Äî charges the US firm has denied.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


CRYPTOCURRENCY

BlockchAIn's Digital Infrastructure Play: A High-Risk, High-Reward Pivot for Signing Day Sports
Source: AInvest    Published: 2025-07-12 19:47:13

News/ Articles/ Articles Details Think of me as your AI global economics lens‚Äîzooming in on the hidden forces quietly rewriting the world's financial rules. The merger between Signing Day Sports, Inc. (NYSE American: SGN) and One Blockchain LLC, forming BlockchAIn Digital Infrastructure, Inc., marks a bold strategic pivot from niche sports recruitment to the high-stakes world of cryptocurrency mining and high-performance computing (HPC). This transformative deal, anchored by a 21% profit margin in One Blockchain's existing operations and a critical SEC regulatory milestone, offers investors an asymmetric opportunity to bet on the growth of digital infrastructure‚Äîif the risks can be navigated. Let us dissect the calculus. The Strategic Pivot: From Niche to New EconomySigning Day Sports, valued at approximately $260 million post-merger, is abandoning its core business‚Äîa platform for college sports recruitment‚Äîto instead control One Blockchain's 40 MW Bitcoin mining facility in South Carolina. The financial rationale is compelling: One Blockchain generated $26.8 million in revenue and $5.7 million in net income in 2024, with a 21% profit margin that outperforms many legacy tech firms. This profitability underscores operational efficiency in a sector where volatility is the norm. The merger aims to position the combined entity as a vertically integrated player in crypto mining and HPC hosting, leveraging One Blockchain's expertise and scalable infrastructure. Regulatory De-Risking: The SEC S-4 Filing as a Turning PointThe submission of a confidential Form S-4 filing to the SEC represents a pivotal step. This document, which includes a proxy statement and prospectus, must be approved alongside shareholder and NYSE American listing approvals. The S-4's clearance would de-risk the deal by addressing regulatory uncertainties, such as compliance with securities laws and disclosure requirements. Investors should note that forward-looking statements in the filing emphasize risks like regulatory delays and market fluctuations, but the process itself signals progress toward the merger's completion‚Äîa stark contrast to earlier-stage SPAC transactions that often fail to clear such hurdles. Market Validation: A 150% Stock Surge, But Caution RemainsThe stock's 150% surge post-announcement (see ) reflects investor optimism about the strategic shift. Yet this rally is fragile: SGN's value hinges on execution. The merger requires shareholder approval, which may be contentious given the abandonment of the sports recruitment business. Additionally, the NYSE American must approve the listing of the new entity‚Äîa hurdle if regulators question the adequacy of One Blockchain's financial disclosures or corporate governance. Scalability and Infrastructure Synergy: The 50MW Expansion and Texas FacilityThe deal's long-term viability rests on One Blockchain's growth plans. The existing South Carolina facility is set to expand to 50 MW by late 2025/early 2026, pending utility approval, to accommodate third-party crypto miners. More significantly, a 150 MW facility in Texas‚Äîphased into 100 MW for internal crypto mining and 50 MW for AI/HPC hosting‚Äîis scheduled for late 2026 completion. This modular design allows flexibility to pivot between revenue streams as market dynamics evolve. Combined with an earnout provision tied to achieving $25 million EBITDA by 2026, these expansions create a clear path to scale profitability if executed successfully. Risk Factors: A Tightrope WalkThree risks loom large. First, shareholder approval is not guaranteed, especially if existing SGN investors question the abandonment of the sports platform. Second, regulatory scrutiny of crypto mining's energy consumption and environmental impact could delay approvals or impose costly compliance burdens. Third, Bitcoin's price volatility‚Äîdown 50% in 2024‚Äîremains a wildcard, though the Texas facility's diversification into HPC hosting mitigates this exposure. Finally, the NYSE's listing requirements, particularly around liquidity and financial thresholds, could scupper the deal if not met. Investment Thesis: A High-Beta Play with Asymmetric UpsideFor investors seeking exposure to digital infrastructure growth, SGN offers a leveraged entry point. The stock's 150% surge post-announcement reflects its beta nature, but the asymmetric return profile is undeniable:- Upside: If the merger clears regulatory hurdles and the Texas facility achieves full capacity, the $25 million EBITDA target could be surpassed, unlocking the earnout and potentially tripling the company's valuation.- Downside: Failure to secure shareholder or regulatory approval would likely collapse the stock to pre-announcement levels (~$0.50), though SGN's existing sports business retains minimal value. A disciplined investor might consider a position in SGN with a tight stop-loss at $1.50 (25% below current levels), targeting a $3.50 price by year-end if the S-4 is approved. However, this is a high-risk, high-reward trade suited only to those comfortable with volatility and regulatory uncertainty. In conclusion, BlockchAIn's merger with Signing Day Sports represents a speculative yet intellectually coherent bet on the future of energy-efficient digital infrastructure. While the path is fraught with execution risks, the combination of One Blockchain's profitability, scalable projects, and the SEC's procedural progress creates a compelling‚Äîif precarious‚Äîopportunity. For those willing to take the leap, SGN could be the beta play of 2025‚Äîif the hurdles are cleared. Ôªø No comments yet
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


SharpLink Gaming Invests $25.7 Million in Ethereum, Price Surges 7.4%
Source: AInvest    Published: 2025-07-12 18:27:06

News/ Articles/ Articles Details Quickly understand the history and background of various well-known coins SharpLink Gaming Ltd. has made a significant investment in the cryptocurrency market by purchasing 10,000 ETH from the Ethereum Foundation. The acquisition, valued at approximately $25.7 million, was completed through an over-the-counter deal at a price of $2,572.37 per ETH. This move highlights the growing institutional adoption of Ethereum and underscores the company's long-term commitment to the Ethereum ecosystem. Joseph Lubin, Chairman of SharpLink and Co-Founder of Ethereum, emphasized that this acquisition is not a speculative trade but a strategic investment aimed at bolstering Ethereum's network security through staking initiatives. By staking and restaking the acquired ETH, SharpLink aims to reduce the circulating supply, thereby supporting the network's value proposition and decentralization. This move positions SharpLink as the largest publicly traded company to adopt Ethereum as its primary treasury reserve asset, setting a precedent for other corporations to follow suit. The Ethereum Foundation, based in Zug, Switzerland, plays a crucial role in the development and growth of the Ethereum protocol. The foundation provides funding, coordination, and guidance to developers, researchers, and innovators, ensuring the continued evolution of the Ethereum ecosystem. Ethereum is widely recognized as the leading blockchain platform for smart contracts and decentralized applications, driving the growth of the Web3 economy. SharpLink Gaming, headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, is at the forefront of the digital capital landscape. The company's strategic move to adopt Ethereum as its primary treasury reserve asset offers investors a unique opportunity to engage with the leading smart-contract platform. Beyond its financial strategy, SharpLink is reimagining the future of online gaming and sports betting. With a veteran team experienced in sports media, gaming, and technology, SharpLink is developing scalable, secure, and transparent solutions that challenge traditional models and bring innovation to the betting experience. By leveraging smart contracts, DeFi protocols, and Web3 infrastructure, SharpLink aims to transform the multi-billion-dollar iGaming industry into a more dynamic, efficient, and equitable ecosystem. This acquisition underscores SharpLink's commitment to the Ethereum ecosystem and its role as a responsible industry steward. By increasing its ETH holdings and actively participating in staking, SharpLink is contributing to the long-term strength and decentralization of the Ethereum network. This move not only benefits SharpLink but also supports the broader Ethereum community, reinforcing the platform's position as a leader in the blockchain space. In response to the acquisition, the Ethereum price surged 7.4% to $3,000, indicating growing institutional interest and investor confidence. This price increase, despite a 51.52% drop in 24-hour volume, highlights the significant impact of SharpLink's investment on the market. The acquisition is the largest public direct Ethereum treasury acquisition, paralleling Bitcoin's rise in corporate treasuries with entities like MicroStrategy. This move could precipitate further treasury allocations by corporations, potentially impacting Ethereum's price appreciation trend and prompting tailored crypto-asset oversight to assure market stability. Joseph Lubin's insights into the long-term implications of this acquisition indicate a shift in how corporations view Ethereum. This move could lead to a more stable and secure market environment, with increased network security and value proposition. SharpLink's commitment to the Ethereum ecosystem sets a precedent for how mission-driven organizations can collaborate to advance shared goals of decentralization, economic empowerment, and protocol-native finance. The Pudgy Penguin Play: How Coinbase's NFT Pivot and ETF Hopes Are Redefining Crypto Branding
Source: AInvest    Published: 2025-07-12 16:57:40

News/ Articles/ Articles Details I'm the AI strategist in your corner, turning dry economic data into actionable intelligence for your portfolio. The crypto world is rarely short on spectacle, but few moments in recent memory have captured the interplay of branding, institutional validation, and meme-driven momentum quite like Coinbase's July 11, 2025, switch to a Pudgy Penguins NFT as its Twitter profile picture. What began as a cheeky nod to the project's community quickly snowballed into a $1.4 billion market cap surge for the PENGU token, a 690% spike in NFT trading volume, and a landmark SEC acknowledgment for an ETF proposal tied to the asset. This wasn't just a PR stunt‚Äîit was a masterclass in how strategic branding and institutional overtures can catalyze value in the crypto space. The Social Media Pivot: AlexOnChain's Influence and Coinbase's New PlaybookThe avatar change was orchestrated during a brief account takeover by AlexOnChain, a pseudonymous crypto influencer known for his viral Twitter threads. Far from a hack, it was a calculated move: Coinbase swiftly hired AlexOnChain as its first ‚ÄúCT Lead‚Äù (a nod to the ‚ÄúChief Twitter‚Äù role popularized by Elon Musk), signaling a shift toward more direct, community-driven communication. The results were immediate. PENGU's price surged 60% within hours of the ‚Äúnew pfp, who dis‚Äù caption, while the floor price of Pudgy Penguins NFTs jumped from 9 ETH to 11.58 ETH. The move underscored a broader trend: crypto firms are increasingly leveraging social media influencers and NFT communities to drive token adoption. Coinbase's pivot‚Äîblending meme culture with institutional credibility‚Äîhighlighted how brands can amplify value through alignment with engaged, decentralized audiences. The ETF Multiplier: Regulatory Validation Meets Meme MomentumThe PENGU rally wasn't just about hype. On July 12, the U.S. Securities and and Exchange Commission acknowledged Canary Capital's filing for a PENGU ETF, which seeks to provide 80%-95% exposure to PENGU and related NFT assets. This marked a critical inflection point: PENGU became only the second meme coin (after Dogecoin) to gain such regulatory traction in the U.S. The ETF's potential approval acts as a catalyst for institutional capital, which has long been hesitant to embrace meme-driven assets. . Analysts like Ali Martinez at CryptoMetrics estimate PENGU could hit $0.060 by August 2025‚Äîa 216% gain from its July 12 high‚Äîif the ETF gains momentum. The ETF's structure also addresses a key pain point for institutional investors: access to NFTs, which are traditionally illiquid and complex to value. The NFT Floor Surge and the Long/Short Ratio: A Bullish SignalThe Pudgy Penguins project itself became a beneficiary of Coinbase's endorsement. Trading volumes for the NFTs skyrocketed 690% in 24 hours, while the long/short ratio on Binance for PENGU hit 1.025‚Äîa bullish indicator signaling retail and institutional buyers are accumulating ahead of potential ETF inflows. This dynamic reveals a critical insight: NFT communities can now serve as both brand ambassadors and price drivers for tokens. Coinbase's move to adopt a Pudgy Penguin avatar wasn't just a marketing gimmick‚Äîit was a statement that NFTs are becoming core to crypto branding, with their ownership and liquidity directly tied to token value. The Bear Case: Volatility and the ETF HurdleOf course, skeptics will point to PENGU's decline to $0.0104 by February 2025‚Äîa 30% drop from its January peak‚Äîas proof of meme coins' inherent volatility. But this overlooks the broader arc: the July surge demonstrated how strategic branding and regulatory milestones can create durable catalysts. The ETF's fate remains pivotal‚Äîapproval would lock in institutional demand, while rejection could spark a prolonged selloff. Investors should also monitor the NFT floor price of Pudgy Penguins. . If the floor holds above 10 ETH amid token price weakness, it suggests community loyalty is intact‚Äîa key buffer against bearish pressure. Investment Thesis: Capitalize on Early MomentumThe Coinbase/PENGU saga offers a blueprint for investors: look for projects where institutional players are aligning with meme-driven communities through branding, and where regulatory tailwinds (like ETFs) are on the horizon. PENGU's current price of $0.019 (as of July 7, 2025) sits below its July highs but offers asymmetric upside if the ETF gains traction. The key risks are clear: regulatory delays, NFT liquidity constraints, and meme fatigue. But the rewards are equally compelling: PENGU's market cap could approach $2 billion if the ETF is approved, while broader adoption of NFT-based branding could push the token into the crypto mainstream. Conclusion: The New Crypto Branding PlaybookCoinbase's Pudgy Penguin pivot isn't just a quirky anecdote‚Äîit's a sign of crypto's evolving maturity. Brands are now leveraging NFT communities as both marketing channels and value drivers, while institutional players are using ETFs to bridge the gap between meme-driven assets and traditional finance. Investors who identify these early-stage catalysts‚Äîwhether through social media moves, regulatory nods, or NFT liquidity‚Äîwill be positioned to profit as crypto's next wave unfolds. In the meme-to-ETF pipeline, Coinbase has set a template. The question now is: who's next? Ôªø No comments yet

Pump.fun Raises $500 Million in 12 Minutes with Record-Breaking ICO
Source: AInvest    Published: 2025-07-12 16:57:26

News/ Articles/ Articles Details Quickly understand the history and background of various well-known coins Pump.fun, a meme coin platform built on the Solana blockchain, has set a new record in the cryptocurrency market by completing one of the fastest and largest Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) in history. The platform successfully sold 125 billion PUMP tokens, raising an impressive $500 million in just 12 minutes. This achievement highlights the surging interest and investment in the meme coin sector, particularly among large investors, commonly referred to as "whales." The public token sale, which excluded participants from the U.S. and required full Know Your Customer (KYC) compliance, offered 33% of PUMP's total supply with no lock-up period. The tokens were priced at $0.004 each, and the company had initially aimed to raise $600 million from the offering. The rapid sell-out of the presale indicates a high level of enthusiasm and trust in the Pump.fun platform and its native token, PUMP. This success also suggests that whales are actively seeking opportunities in the meme coin space, despite potential concerns about the long-term prospects of these tokens. Pump.fun gained prominence in 2024 as the go-to platform for creating Solana-based meme coins. However, with this ICO, the company aims to move beyond meme culture, outlining plans to build a decentralized alternative to mainstream social platforms. The platform's ability to generate significant revenue through memecoin launches demonstrates its potential to build a decentralized social network and foster a vibrant community around its tokens. Momentum had been building ahead of the July 12 launch. Earlier in the week, Pump.fun acquired Kolscan, a Solana wallet tracker that ranks key opinion leaders (KOLs) based on their trading performance. The new feature will enable users to analyze top investor strategies in real-time, a compelling tool for retail traders seeking to track whale activity. This strategic move further solidifies Pump.fun's position in the market and enhances its platform to attract more investors. Several whales placed large bets ahead of the ICO. According to Lookonchain data from July 12, three major wallets deposited around $7 million USDC into Hyperliquid, opening long positions on PUMP. One of these whales, known for turning a $1.19 million investment in Official Trump (TRUMP) into $438 million, created a new wallet and deposited $1 million USDC into the PUMP presale. Not all bets were bullish, however. Another whale reportedly shorted PUMP using $8 million USDC at 2x leverage. By press time, the position was sitting on an unrealized loss of $800,000, with a looming liquidation price of $0.008513. With the ICO and market sentiment broadly bullish, all eyes are on how PUMP will perform in the days ahead. The rapid sell-out of the PUMP token presale and the involvement of prominent whales indicate a strong appetite for meme coins among large investors. This trend is likely to continue as more platforms and tokens enter the market, driven by the potential for high returns and the growing interest in decentralized finance. However, investors should remain cautious and conduct thorough research before participating in ICOs, as the meme coin market is known for its volatility and speculative nature. Ôªø No comments yet

Pump.fun Swiftly Raises $500M in Public Sale at $4B Fully Diluted Valuation
Source: coindesk.com    Published: 2025-07-12 16:52:30

12 minutes. That's how long it took for Pump.fun's token offering to raise roughly $500 million from retail investors across various exchanges, including Bybit, Kraken, and KuCoin. The sale priced 125 billion tokens at $0.004 apiece, implying a $4 billion fully diluted valuation for the Solana-based memecoin launcher's new utility token. For now, holders must wait to get their hands on the token they bought. Pump.fun said the purchased tokens will land in wallets over the next 48‚Äì72 hours and will stay locked until distribution ends, blocking trades or transfers. The team shared the official Solana contract address‚Äî pumpCmXqMfrsAkQ5r49WcJnRayYRqmXz6ae8H7H9Dfn‚Äî and warned users to shun look-alike assets. Read more: PUMP Lingers at 40% Premium Over ICO Price on Hyperliquid Ahead of Pump.fun Token Sale In total, Pump.fun's ICO was set to sell 33% of PUMP's 1 trillion token supply, with 18% having already been allocated earlier via a private sale. The public allocation was recently lowered from 15% to 12.5%, which sold out in just 12 minutes. Its other allocations include 20% for the team behind the project, 24% for community and ecosystem incentives, 13% for existing investors, 2.6% for liquidity, 2.4% for an ecosystem fund, with the remaining for a foundation fund and live streaming incentives. Pump.fun allows anyone to mint and list a coin with a new token in a few clicks. When a freshly minted token reaches a specific threshold, it gets listed on decentralized exchanges. The sale comes as the token launchpad's metrics show a deepening decline in activity. DeFiLlama data shows that in January Pump.fun's launchpad volume was above $11.6 billion, and has since been steadily declining to $3.65 billion last month. Similarly, revenue generated via the launchpad dropped from $133 million in the first month of the year to nearly $34 million last month, according to DeFiLlama data. While launchpad volumes plunged, Pump.fun's decentralized exchange PumpSwap, which was launched in March, has been making up for the decline, seeing $14.3 billion of volume in May and $10 billion last month. Revenue for PumpSwap stood at $7 and $5 million for those months, per the same data source. UPDATE (July 12, 15:54 UTC): Adds more context throughout. ETH Treasury News: Another BTC Mining Firm Moves Into Ethereum Reserve, Hailing ETH as ‚ÄòDigital Gold'
Source: coindesk.com    Published: 2025-07-12 16:51:08

Bitcoin mining firm, BTC Digital (BTCT), has moved $1 million of company cash into ether (ETH), which it called its new ‚Äúdigital gold.‚Äù BTCT Moved $1M Into Ethereum Reserve, chief executive officer Siguang Peng said in a press release, adding that Ethereum has ‚Äúemerged as the foundation of on-chain USD settlement and value transfer.‚Äù "By securing an initial $1‚ÄØmillion ETH reserve today‚Äîand with plans to scale that position‚Äîwe are proactively positioning ourselves for decentralized finance, stablecoin issuance, and asset tokenization,‚Äù Peng said. BTCT plans to grow the reserve as upgrades lift capacity and U.S. rules solidify. BTC Digital was previously a bitcoin mining company. The firm recently said that "its 20‚ÄØMW large‚Äìscale cryptocurrency mining project in Georgia has reached a significant milestone." The company doesn't state if it still plans to mine bitcoin, but said it is "building on its origins in large‚Äìscale crypto mining, BTCT is undergoing a strategic evolution from "hash‚Äìrate provider" to "on‚Äìchain financial infrastructure participant," in the press release. BTC Digital is the second publicly traded bitcoin miner turning to an ether treasury. Earlier this month Bit Digital (BTBT) shifted its entire treasury from BTC to ETH as it moved to a staking strategy. The move saw its stock jump up to 30%. It has since corrected in a nearly 20% drop. Meanwhile, BTCT's stock closed Friday's trading session 13% higher. Publicly-known ether treasuries, which include the treasuries of decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), Layer-2 networks, and publicly-traded firms, currently hold more than 1.34 million ETH, according to a public tracker. He owns bitcoin, ether, solana, and PAXG above CoinDesk's $1,000 disclosure threshold. About Contact

Zed Champions: DIGITAL HORSE RACING DROVE AMERICAN CARDROOM'S PUSH INTO NFTs, CRYPTO
Source: Horse Race Insider    Published: 2025-07-12 15:52:34

The Horse Race Insider is a privately owned magazine. All copyrights reserved. ‚ÄúBet with your head, not over it.‚Äù The Conscience of Thoroughbred Racing By HRI Foreign Staff ‚Äî In a bold return to the digital track, Virtually Human Studio has officially rebooted its famed Web3 horse racing game Zed Run as the newly launched Zed Champions: a skill-based, 24/7 virtual horse racing ecosystem built for a new era of strategy, ownership, and blockchain integration. The game is currently in beta, and excitement is mounting in both Web3 and horse betting communities. Designed around dynamic breeding, automated race schedules, and $ZED token integration, Zed Champions is not just a visual or technical update; it's a complete overhaul aimed at sustainability and deeper engagemen https://www.instagram.com/p/DLOvRAZMyhy/?igsh=eHNzZ21mZmk4aTlo Zed Run had once been a beacon of innovation in the NFT world, having processed over $400 million in digital horse transactions and bred more than 420,000 racehorses. But like many NFT platforms, it stumbled during the market's downturn. Zed Champions is VHS's answer to those challenges, as a refined, skill-based model that discourages speculation and favors strategic play. With features like auction-based breeding, leaderboard scoring, and race-driven rewards, players are now invited to manage virtual stables like a fantasy sports team, without needing to manually schedule races. What sets Zed Champions apart is its continuous ecosystem: a race every 80 seconds, around the clock, driven entirely by blockchain. Digital horses are matched based on real-time balance performance, and players can boost horses using Augments, which are special modifiers that influence performance in subtle but critical ways. For Web2 holdouts or crypto newcomers, VHS has introduced Zed Picks, a companion mobile app that allows spectators to cheer on horses, place bets using virtual currency, and win sweepstakes prizes with no crypto wallet required. As the game moves into full launch, many in the industry are watching Zed Champions closely as a test case for the future of NFT-powered sports. Among them is Americas Cardroom, whose adoption of cryptocurrency and blockchain tools was directly inspired by the early success of Zed Run. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lNcwuY4uiuc&t=2039s For Americas Cardroom CEO Phil Nagy, the connection between poker and digital horse racing was not immediately obvious until poker legend Chris Moneymaker introduced him to Zed Run. ‚ÄúIn typical Phil fashion, he ignored it for weeks,‚Äù Americas Cardroom Pro Moneymaker said in a recent interview. ‚ÄúAnd then he was, like, ‚ÄòWhy didn't you tell me about this before?' He totally got it.‚Äù That revelation would end up transforming the way Americas Cardroom approached payment processing and community engagement. Moneymaker, famous for catalyzing the online poker boom with his 2003 World Series of Poker win, saw clear parallels between blockchain gaming and poker: both are strategy-driven, decentralized, and benefit immensely from instant, secure money transfers. Once introduced to crypto, blockchain, and NFTs, Nagy immersed himself in the technology. He set up servers, built e-wallet knowledge, and began experimenting with real-world applications. The result? Americas Cardroom quickly became one of the most crypto-integrated poker platforms in the world. Today, you can play poker on the site with the option to use over 60 different cryptocurrencies, from Bitcoin and Ethereum to lesser-known altcoins, making cross-border transactions seamless and instant. This has proven especially valuable in the poker world, where quick liquidity is often the difference between joining a game or missing out. ‚ÄúYou can pay customers in seconds,‚Äù said Nagy. ‚ÄúThey can deposit fast; there are no fees or delays you get with other payment processors.‚Äù His vision goes even further. Nagy believes NFTs can serve as a transparent ledger for tournament records, player identities, and digital collectibles. While some online casinos have treated NFTs as temporary fads or promotional gimmicks, Americas Cardroom has looked at blockchain with a more positive outlook. Nagy, Moneymaker, and the rest of the Americas Cardroom team see a future where digital ownership intersects with competitive play, and the original spark came from the virtual world of Zed Run. Digital horse racing is no longer just a niche curiosity. It's rapidly evolving into a vibrant subsection of the sports betting and gaming industry, thanks to NFT-driven platforms like Zed Champions, Game of Silks, and Stables. Take Game of Silks, for example, which tokenizes the annual crop of real-world US thoroughbreds and converts them into tradeable in-game NFTs. Players who own a Silks horse receive rewards when their real-world counterpart wins races or produces offspring. It's a ‚Äúplay-to-earn‚Äù model with real-life stakes, which has attracted over 25,000 players worldwide. In partnership with the New York Racing Association, Game of Silks is helping traditional horse racing tap into younger, tech-savvy audiences without compromising the sport's integrity. Meanwhile, in Europe, France's Pari Mutuel Urbain (PMU) launched Stables, an NFT horse racing platform on the Tezos blockchain. The game uses historical racing data and advanced algorithms to simulate virtual races, allowing users to train and race their horses for digital and real-world prizes. Within days of launch, nearly 5,000 of the first 6,666 horse NFTs were sold, showing strong demand despite the broader NFT market's volatility. Even brands like Stella Artois are experimenting with NFT horse racing campaigns ‚Äî proof that this trend is entering mainstream advertising and branding circles. The convergence of horse racing, virtual reality, and NFTs is part of a long-term shift toward digital sports entertainment. For traditional bettors of an older generation, especially those familiar with horse betting and poker, the appeal lies in a familiar pastime reimagined for the digital age. The thrill of betting, the pride of owning a stable, and the excitement of strategy all remain intact, but now they come with the added bonus of ownership, liquidity, and borderless participation. It's no surprise, then, that companies like Americas Cardroom are taking notes. As Web3 gaming continues to mature and as digital horse racing platforms refine their ecosystems, expect to see further crossover between poker and racing: two industries that thrive on competition, community, and chance. Zed Champions may just be the frontrunner in this movement, but it's not racing alone. And with poker powerhouses like Americas Cardroom galloping into the NFT and crypto space, the finish line is only the beginning. Our staff likes nothing better than to engage with the HRI Faithful and provide a forum for interaction on horseracing and sports. In that spirit, please be kind and reasonable; keep the language clean, and the tone civil. Comments from those who cannot comply will be deleted. Thank you. Your email address will not be published. Coinbase's Pudgy Penguin Avatar Change, ETF Hopes Ignite 60% PENGU Rally
Source: CoinDesk    Published: 2025-07-12 14:23:43

Coinbase broke with its usual blue logo on X, posting a Pudgy Penguins non-fungible token as its profile picture alongside the quip ‚Äúnew pfp, who dis.‚Äù new pfp, who dis Minutes later, PENGU, the native token of the penguin-themed ecosystem, started surging. The token rose more than 60% in the rally before enduring a correction, but it's still up more than 35% for the week. The official Pudgy Penguins account mirrored the move, sending matching ice-blue avatars gliding across feeds and leading to talk of a partnership between Coinbase and Igloo Inc., the startup that steers the collection. Various crypto-related firms, including VanEck, MoonPay, and AwakenTax, have since changed their profile pictures to pudgy penguins. The stunt has also lifted the floor price of Pudgy Penguin NFTs, which was earlier this week around 9 ETH, and quickly jumped to 11.58 ETH according to NFTPriceFloor data. The volume for the project's NFTs grew nearly 690% in the last 24 hours. Coinbase changed its profile picture during a short account takeover from pseudonymous Crypto Twitter personality AlexOnChain, who previously led the social media account of leading cryptocurrency exchange Binance for four years. After the takeover, Coinbase revealed they're hiring AlexOnChain as their first full-time ‚ÄúCT Lead.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe new focus is making comms more social native - direct, transparent, and engaging. That's the path to building a bigger appreciation for everything they've contributed to this space (which is a lot), and to help reconnect with ct,‚Äù Alex said in a post. ‚ÄúIt's a big job, it won't be easy, and that's why I took it.‚Äù PENGU's price rise also comes as the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) acknowledged Canary Capital's filing for a spot PENGU ETF. BTC, ETH, XRP Price News: Bitcoin, Ether Tentative, XRP Steady as Trump Announces 30% Tariff on EU and Mexico
Source: CoinDesk    Published: 2025-07-12 13:41:42

Major cryptocurrencies, excluding XRP, registered moderate losses as President Donald Trump announced fresh tariffs on imports from Mexico and the European Union (EU). The President slapped 30% levy on the two trading partners, which will take effect from Aug. 1, according to letters Trump posted on his Truth Social account. "Mexico has been helping me secure the border. BUT, what Mexico has done, is not enough," Trump wrote in a letter to Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum. In another letter to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, Trump called the relationship with the EU far from reciprocal. Early this week, Trump issued new tariffs for several countries, including South Korea, Japan, Canada and Brazil, along with a 50% tariff on copper, triggering volatility in the market for the red metal. Bitcoin BTC$117,407.29, the leading cryptocurrency by market value, traded around $117,400 following Trump's announcement, down 0.6% from the European session high of $118,200. Prices have failed to establish a foothold above $118,000 multiple times since Friday's early Asian trading hours, CoinDesk data show. Ether (ETH), the second-largest token, traded 1% lower on the day (UTC) at $2,930, having put in an indecisive doji candle Friday. Solana's SOL and DOGE traded over 2% lower while BNB was down 0.7%. Meanwhile, payments-focused XRP traded relatively resilient, flashing a 1.78% gain as of writing. The weak tone followed intense bullish price action mid-week that saw BTC blow past the long-held resistance at $110K, prompting renewed risk-taking in the broader crypto market. Some analysts anticipated a continued indecisive price action over the weekend. "Expectations this weekend are we chop around in tight range today. Then Asia comes in late on Sunday evening and buys ALL the Bitcoin, and we break through $120k," the founders of the newsletter service LondonCryptoClub said on X. UPDATE (July 12, 16:56 UTC): Corrects bitcoin price in 5th paragraph. Omkar Godbole is a Co-Managing Editor on CoinDesk's Markets team based in Mumbai, holds a masters degree in Finance and a Chartered Market Technician (CMT) member. Omkar previously worked at FXStreet, writing research on currency markets and as fundamental analyst at currency and commodities desk at Mumbai-based brokerage houses. Omkar holds small amounts of bitcoin, ether, BitTorrent, tron and dot. About Contact

BTC, ETH, XRP Price News: Bitcoin, Ether Tentative, XRP Steady as Trump Announces 30% Tariff on EU and Mexico
Source: CoinDesk    Published: 2025-07-12 13:41:42

Major cryptocurrencies, excluding XRP, registered moderate losses as President Donald Trump announced fresh tariffs on imports from Mexico and the European Union (EU). The President slapped 30% levy on the two trading partners, which will take effect from Aug. 1, according to letters Trump posted on his Truth Social account. "Mexico has been helping me secure the border. BUT, what Mexico has done, is not enough," Trump wrote in a letter to Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum. In another letter to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, Trump called the relationship with the EU far from reciprocal. Early this week, Trump issued new tariffs for several countries, including South Korea, Japan, Canada and Brazil, along with a 50% tariff on copper, triggering volatility in the market for the red metal. Bitcoin BTC$117,400.53, the leading cryptocurrency by market value, traded around $117,400 following Trump's announcement, down 0.6% from the European session high of $118,200. Prices have failed to establish a foothold above $118,000 multiple times since Friday's early Asian trading hours, CoinDesk data show. Ether (ETH), the second-largest token, traded 1% lower on the day (UTC) at $2,930, having put in an indecisive doji candle Friday. Solana's SOL and DOGE traded over 2% lower while BNB was down 0.7%. Meanwhile, payments-focused XRP traded relatively resilient, flashing a 1.78% gain as of writing. The weak tone followed intense bullish price action mid-week that saw BTC blow past the long-held resistance at $110K, prompting renewed risk-taking in the broader crypto market. Some analysts anticipated a continued indecisive price action over the weekend. "Expectations this weekend are we chop around in tight range today. Then Asia comes in late on Sunday evening and buys ALL the Bitcoin, and we break through $120k," the founders of the newsletter service LondonCryptoClub said on X. UPDATE (July 12, 16:56 UTC): Corrects bitcoin price in 5th paragraph. ‚ÄòUltimately No Limit' to the Price of Bitcoin ($BTC): Hedge Fund Manager James Lavish
Source: CoinDesk    Published: 2025-07-12 13:08:43

At the time of writing, bitcoin BTC$117,407.29 is hovering around the $118,000 level, flirting with the idea of setting a new all-time high this weekend. On Friday, Bloomberg Senior ETF Analyst Eric Balchunas noted on X that BlackRock's spot Bitcoin ETF (IBIT) had reached an important milestone at the close of trading on the previous day, becoming the fastest ETF to reach $80 billion in assets under management (AUM). The second fastest ETF to achieve this level was Vanguard's S&P 500 ETF (VOO), which reached it in 1,814 days. This was the same day on which we saw bitcoin set a new all-time high of $118,667. During interviews with CNBC and Yahoo Finance, Bitwise Asset Management CIO Matt Hougan said his firm expects the BTC price to reach over $200,000 by the end of this year. As for how high bitcoin could go, hedge fund manager James Lavish says that the bitcoin price is similar to the U.S. debt ceiling in that, ultimately, there is no limit. Asia's tokenization boom is shifting capital away from the West: Expert
Source: Cointelegraph    Published: 2025-07-12 12:56:06

Asia's regulatory frameworks in tokenization are attracting global investors, with Japan and Hong Kong setting the pace for real-world asset adoption. Asia's leadership in tokenization is drawing growing attention from global investors, with regulatory clarity in the region attracting capital that was once on the sidelines, according to Maarten Henskens, head of protocol growth at Startale Group. ‚ÄúWe're seeing Western institutions set up Asia-Pacific operations not just to follow capital, but to participate in innovation,‚Äù he told Cointelegraph. Henskens pointed out the distinct yet complementary approaches taken by Japan and Hong Kong to advance real-world asset (RWA) adoption. Japan's regulatory framework has been deliberate and forward-looking, establishing a strong foundation of institutional trust. ‚ÄúMUFG's infrastructure for security token issuance is a good example of how the ecosystem is maturing,‚Äù he noted. Japan's Payment Services Act (PSA) also allows trusted stablecoins to hold up to 50% of their reserves in low-risk government bonds and term deposits, demonstrating a thoughtful approach to regulation. Hong Kong, by contrast, has moved swiftly, launching the Ensemble Sandbox as a fast-track regulatory innovation hub. ‚ÄúWhile Japan is building long-term depth, Hong Kong is showing how agility can bring experimentation to life,‚Äù Henskens said. Related: ‚ÄòEverything is lining up' ‚Äî Tokenization is having its breakout moment The rise of tokenized bonds and ETFs is playing a key role in bringing traditional investors into crypto markets. In Japan, real estate security tokens are making previously closed markets accessible to retail investors, sometimes more so than traditional J-REITs. Tokenization streamlines fund administration and increases transparency, allowing asset managers to connect directly with end-users. ‚ÄúThis efficiency, paired with improved transparency, could make these products compelling to traditional investors who might not otherwise enter the crypto space,‚Äù Henskens said. He flagged cross-border interoperability as the next major milestone. ‚ÄúSeamless and compliant movement of tokenized assets across jurisdictions‚Äù will be critical for scaling adoption. In Asia, this means linking infrastructure across countries like Japan and Hong Kong, while globally, regulatory frameworks must reflect the technical realities of tokenized finance, especially around settlement, compliance, and custody. Related: Dubai launches first licensed tokenized real estate project in MENA region Dubai has been another Asian country making strides in tokenization. The city's regulatory authorities have introduced progressive frameworks that encourage the issuance and trading of tokenized securities, attracting global investors and fintech firms. In May, the Virtual Asset Regulatory Authority, Dubai's crypto regulator, updated its guidelines to include provisions for RWA tokenization. Lawyer Irina Heaver told Cointelegraph these rules give issuers and exchanges a clear path to launch and trade tokenized real estate assets. Last month, the Dubai Land Department, in collaboration with VARA and top developers, successfully tokenized and sold two apartments, with the entire offering selling out within minutes, according to Heaver. Buyers came from over 35 countries, and notably, 70% were first-time real estate investors in Dubai. ‚ÄúWe're already seeing a network effect: innovation in one jurisdiction sparks progress in another,‚Äù Henskens said. ‚ÄúDifferent regions may optimize for different outcomes, and that's a strength, not a liability,‚Äù he added. Magazine: Tokenizing music royalties as NFTs could help the next Taylor Swift Cointelegraph is committed to providing independent, high-quality journalism across the crypto, blockchain, AI, fintech, and iGaming industries. This means we may receive a commission if you click through and take action‚Äîsuch as signing up for a service or making a purchase. These commissions come at no additional cost to you. Our affiliate relationships help us maintain an open-access platform, but they do not influence our editorial decisions. All news, reviews, and analysis are produced with journalistic independence and integrity. Thank you for supporting responsible and accessible reporting.
